weather_load_skepticism.response: Our verification methodology eliminates that variable. All dataset comparisons are strictly controlled: we either compare 'Exact Matching Conditions' (identical load/temperature bins) or use ASHRAE-compliant regression analysis to normalize the data. This ensures the measured improvement is purely mechanical (efficiency restoration), not environmental.
evidence: IPMVP Option B methodology requires condition matching or normalization
F2 FMV platform tracks outdoor air temperature, humidity, and load continuously
PE certification validates the normalization approach meets engineering standards
US Patent 11,062,404 covers enthalpy-based measurement that isolates mechanical efficiency from environmental variables
weather_load_skepticism.technical_detail: The patented methodology calculates 'normalized post-treatment efficacy' by regressing performance against outdoor conditions. This isolates the true mechanical improvement from weather/load noise.

modern_equipment_objection.objection: My equipment is new with modern POE oil - it doesn't foul like old systems
modern_equipment_objection.response: Actually, modern high-efficiency equipment is MORE vulnerable to oil fouling, not less. High fin density and micro-channel heat exchanger designs maximize surface area for heat transfer - but this also means they're more sensitive to the insulating effects of oil boundary layers. Even a thin oil film on these complex surfaces causes significant heat transfer degradation. Prevention treatment is MORE critical on modern equipment.
evidence: High fin density designs have 2-3x the surface area of older heat exchangers

ASHRAE documents oil migration begins immediately upon commissioning
